title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.18 - Executive Order No. 18: [Creating the New York State Office of Economic Opportunity.][*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.18 - Executive Order No. 18: [Creating the New York State Office of Economic Opportunity.][*]
State Regulations

By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution
and the laws of the State of New York, I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Governor of
the State of New York, do hereby create in the Executive Department a new
office, to be known as the New York State Office of Economic Opportunity, to
implement the Federal Economic Opportunity Act of nineteen hundred sixty-four, with the following duties, powers and authorities: I
To provide technical assistance to communities in
developing, conducting and administering community action programs. II
To provide or arrange for special training programs to
assist communities in establishing and staffing their community programs and
acquaint personnel in public and non-public agencies with the techniques and
problems encountered in the operation of programs for the disadvantaged. III
To coordinate the efforts of all departments and divisions
of the State government participating in the economic opportunity
program. IV
To contract for, accept or agree to accept, with the
approval of the Governor, funds from the federal government granted under the
provisions of the Economic Opportunity Act of nineteen hundred
sixty-four. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: March 1, 1965

Footnotes
*
[Revoked by Executive Order

No. 33, infra.]

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
